Metron | 121 * | 69 | 35 | 18 | 14 | 12 | 21 | 10 |- style="text-align:center;" ! 17 June 2012 ! Election ! 129 * ! 71 ! 33 ! 20 ! 12 ! 18 ! 17 ! 0 |} : * including the 50 extra seats for being the largest party. ===Exit polls=== The first exit polls, being based upon 80% of the interviewed voters and published at 7pm, had New Democracy narrowly in the lead, far within the margin of error.{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_17/06/2012_447535|title=Exit polls show ND and SYRIZA neck and neck for first place |publisher=Ekathimerini|date=17 June 2012|accessdate=17 June 2012}} While the second exit poll, being based upon 100% of the interviewed voters and published at 8pm, now had New Democracy with a clear lead over Syriza, exceeding the margin of error.{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_17/06/2012_447555|title=Second exit poll gives ND clearer lead over SYRIZA |publisher=Ekathimerini|date=17 June 2012|accessdate=17 June 2012}} {| class="wikitable unsortable" |- ! Exit polls
! [[New Democracy (Greece)|ND]]/[[Democratic Alliance (Greece)|DISY]] ! [[Coalition of the Radical Left|SYRIZA]] ! [[Panhellenic Socialist Movement|PASOK]] ! [[Independent Greeks|ANEL]] ! [[Communist Party of Greece|KKE]] ! [[Golden Dawn (Greece)|XA]] ! [[Democratic Left (Greece)|DIMAR]] ! [[Recreate Greece|DX]]/[[Drasi|DRASI]]-[[Liberal Alliance (Greece)|FS]] ! [[Ecologist Greens|OP]] ! [[Popular Orthodox Rally|LAOS]] ! [[List of political parties in Greece|Others]] |- style="text-align:center;" ! Exit poll at 7pm{{cite web|url=http://newpost.gr/post/134564/%CE%9D%CE%94-27-5---30-5----%CE%A3%CE%A5%CE%A1%CE%99%CE%96%CE%91-27---30---%CE%A0%CE%91%CE%A3%CE%9F%CE%9A-10--12-/ |title=Î?Î" 27,5 - 30,5%, ÎŁÎĽÎĄÎ™Î–Î‘ 27 - 30%, Î Î‘ÎŁÎ&#x;Îš 10- 12% |publisher=Newpost.gr |date= |accessdate=3 July 2012}} | '''27.5-30.5''' | 27.0-30.0 | 10.0-12.0 | 6.0-7.5 | 5.0-6.0 | 6.0-7.5 | 5.5-6.5 | 1.5-2.0 | 1.0-1.5 | 1.5-2.0 | 1.5-2.0 |- style="text-align:center;" ! Exit poll at 8pm | '''28.6-30.0''' | 27.5-28.4 | 11.0-12.4 | 6.8-7.8 | 4.8-5.6 | 6.5-7.1 | 5.8-6.6 | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A |- style="text-align:center;" !Election result !29.7 !26.9 !12.3 !7.5 !4.5 !6.9 !6.2 !1.6 !0.9 !1.6 !1.9 |} According to the analysis of exit poll, SYRIZA had a significant lead for the age groups 18–34 years and 35–54 years, while ND had a significant lead in regards of the age group above 55 years:{{cite web|url=http://www.kathimerini.gr/4dcgi/_w_articles_kathremote_1_17/06/2012_447538| script-title=el:Προβάδισμα του ΣΥΡΙΖΑ στις ηλικίες ως 54 ετών| language=Greek|publisher=Kathimerini.gr|date=17 June 2012|accessdate=17 June 2012}} * Exit poll (18–34 years): '''SYRIZA=33%''', ND=20%, PASOK=6%. * Exit poll (35–54 years): '''SYRIZA=34%''', ND=24%, PASOK=8%. * Exit poll (> 55 years): SYRIZA=20%, '''ND=39%''', PASOK=17%. ==Campaign== Even before the election had been called, [[Democratic Left (Greece)|Democratic Left]] (DIMAR) leader Kouvelis stated that DIMAR would likely not want to participate in a [[Coalition of the Radical Left]] (SYRIZA) led government even after repeated elections, as SYRIZA had declined to participate in a unity government with [[New Democracy (Greece)|New Democracy]] (ND), [[Panhellenic Socialist Movement]] (PASOK), and DIMAR.{{cite news|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_14/05/2012_442025|publisher=Ekathimerini|title=Democratic Left rejects cooperation with SYRIZA even after possible elections|date=14 May 2012|accessdate=16 May 2012}} Before the election, it was expected that larger parties would try to form alliances with smaller parties; specifically, ND was in negotiations with [[Democratic Alliance (Greece)|Democratic Alliance]] (DISY), while DISY was also negotiating with [[Drasi|Action]] (DRASI),{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_14/05/2012_442116 |title=Centrist leader seeks to marshal pro-European forces |publisher=ekathimerini.com |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=17 May 2012}} and SYRIZA was trying to form an alliance with [[Social Agreement]] (KOISY).{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/18/world/europe/caretaker-greek-cabinet-is-sworn-in.html|title=Temporary Cabinet Named in Greece as Agency Lowers Nation’s Debt Rating|first=Niki|last=Kitsantonis|date=17 May 2012|newspaper=The New York Times|accessdate=19 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_27011_16/05/2012_442477 |title=Parties switch attention to new elections |publisher=ekathimerini.com |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=17 May 2012}} There were also rumours of SYRIZA negotiating with the [[Ecologist Greens]] (OP) and [[Front of the Greek Anticapitalist Left|Anticapitalist Left Cooperation for the Overthrow -Front of anticapitalist, revolutionary, communist and radical Left Ecology]] (ANTARSYA).{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-18056677 |title=Greece: Trying to understand Syriza |publisher=BBC |accessdate=17 May 2012 |date=14 May 2012}} The other left parties however all ended to decide they would not merge or form a new coalition with SYRIZA. Another important change however happened for SYRIZA on 22 May, where the steering committee decided to transform the "Coalition of the Radical Left", from its 10 coalition parties into a single independent party with the new name "Syriza Unionist Social Front".{{cite news|url=http://www.kathimerini.gr/4dcgi/_w_articles_kathremote_1_22/05/2012_443394|title=Ενιαίο πολιτικό κόμμα ο ΣΥΡΙΖΑ [Single political party SYRIZA]|language=Greek|publisher=kathimerini.gr|date=22 May 2012|accessdate=22 May 2012}} The driving force behind the transformation from coalition to a united party, was the current Greek election law, stipulating that any coalitions participating in a parliamentary election should have their votes split up for each party in the coalition, before determining who became the largest party in the election and thus qualified to win the 50 extra bonus seats in the parliament. So the transformation by itself, greatly increased the chance of SYRIZA also to win bonus seats in the election. ND and DISY announced a complete merger of the two parties into an overall united party on 21 May,{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20120521-711429.html |title=Greek Conservatives Join Forces With Liberal Party|work=Wall Street Journal|date=21 May 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2012-05/22/content_15353055.htm |title=Greek conservative parties join forces for elections |work=China Daily |accessdate=26 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.euractiv.com/elections/greece-bakoyannis-gives-lifeline-new-democracy-news-512867 |title=Greece´s Bakoyannis gives lifeline to New Democracy |publisher=EurActiv |date=22 May 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012}} and the following three parties announced on the same day an agreement to run the election as a new joint coalition: [[Recreate Greece]] – [[Drasi|Action]] – [[Liberal Alliance (Greece)|Liberal Alliance]] (DX-DRASI-FS).{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_21/05/2012_443034 |title=Parties forge alliances ahead of June vote |publisher=ekathimerini.com |accessdate=26 May 2012}} [[Social Agreement]] announced at 19 May their main goal was to establish a new "left government", and in order to achieve such a goal, they would abstain to participate in the election, and instead use all their energy to arrange meetings with all other progressive left parties, with the purpose of creating a convergence program for the parties to make formation of a new "left government" possible after the elections in June.{{cite web|url=http://www.koinonikisymfonia.gr/%CF%80%CE%B5%CF%81%CE%B9%CE%B5%CF%87%CF%8C%CE%BC%CE%B5%CE%BD%CE%BF/%CE%BD%CE%AD%CE%BF/794/1%CE%B7%CF%82-%CF%80%CE%B1%CE%BD%CE%B5%CE%BB%CE%BB%CE%AE%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%B1-%CF%83%CF%85%CE%BD%CE%AC%CE%BD%CF%84%CE%B7%CF%83%CE%B7-%CF%83%CF%84%CE%B5%CE%BB%CE%B5%CF%87%CF%8E%CE%BD-%CF%84%CE%B7%CF%82-%CE%BA%CE%BF%CE%B9%CE%BD%CF%89%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%BA%CE%B7%CF%83-%CF%83%CF%85%CE%BC%CF%86%CF%89%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%B1%CF%83 |title=1st National Meeting executives SOCIAL AGREEMENT |language=Greek|publisher=Social Agreement (koinonikisymfonia.gr)|date=19 May 2012 |accessdate=3 June 2012}} On 28 May the [[Democratic Left (Greece)|Democratic Left]] (DIMAR) however repeated their previous stance, that it would only work with SYRIZA to form a "left government", on the condition that there were guarantees of staying within the eurozone, and this would according to DIMAR require SYRIZA to drop their idea of a unilateral cancellation of the "memorandum" (a nickname for: "The bailout deal that the previous Greek government agreed to implement with EU, [[European Central Bank|ECB]] and [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]]").{{cite news|last=Petrakis |first=Maria |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-05-28/greek-democratic-left-demands-euro-pledge-to-back-syriza.html |title=Greek Democratic Left Demands Euro Pledge to Back Syriza |publisher=Bloomberg |date=28 May 2012 |accessdate=18 June 2012}} As none of the other left parties (OP, ANTARSYA and KKE), neither wanted to accept signing the proposed agreement of a unilateral rejection of the "memorandum" in favour of SYRIZAs new "National Recovery Plan", the attempt by Social Agreement to form a multilateral agreement between "all progressive left parties" ahead of the election failed. Instead only a small bilateral agreement between SYRIZA and Social Agreement was signed, outlining what the cornerstones of the new policy should be, if the election ended with a parliamentary majority for SYRIZA to form a one party government.{{cite web|url=http://www.koinonikisymfonia.gr/%CF%80%CE%B5%CF%81%CE%B9%CE%B5%CF%87%CF%8C%CE%BC%CE%B5%CE%BD%CE%BF/%CE%BD%CE%AD%CE%BF/795/%CE%BF%CE%BC%CE%B9%CE%BB%CE%AF%CE%B1-%CF%80%CF%81%CE%BF%CE%AD%CE%B4%CF%81%CE%BF%CF%85-%CE%BA%CE%BF%CE%B9%CE%BD%CF%89%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%BA%CE%B7%CF%83-%CF%83%CF%85%CE%BC%CF%86%CF%89%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%B1%CF%83-%CE%BB%CE%BF%CF%8D%CE%BA%CE%B1%CF%82-%CF%84-%CE%BA%CE%B1%CF%84%CF%83%CE%AD%CE%BB%CE%B7-%CF%83%CF%84%CE%B7%CE%BD-1%CE%B7-%CF%80%CE%B1%CE%BD%CE%B5%CE%BB%CE%BB%CE%AE%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%B1-%CF%83%CF%85%CE%BD%CE%AC%CE%BD%CF%84%CE%B7 |title=Speech by President SOCIAL AGREEMENT Lucas T. Katseli the first nationwide meeting of party executives. |language=Greek|publisher=Social Agreement (koinonikisymfonia.gr)|date=21 May 2012 |accessdate=3 June 2012}} On 7 June, the executive committee of Social Agreement decided they did not want to merge with SYRIZA, and reaffirmed they neither wanted to participate in any political coalitions, because they believed it was needed for them to stay as an independent neutral party, in order best to help creating a consensus among the left parties to form a new SYRIZA led government.{{cite web|url=http://www.koinonikisymfonia.gr/%CF%80%CE%B5%CF%81%CE%B9%CE%B5%CF%87%CF%8C%CE%BC%CE%B5%CE%BD%CE%BF/%CE%BD%CE%AD%CE%BF/850/%CE%B1%CE%BD%CE%B1%CE%BA%CE%BF%CE%AF%CE%BD%CF%89%CF%83%CE%B7-%CE%B9%CE%B4%CF%81%CF%85%CF%84%CE%B9%CE%BA%CE%AE%CF%82-%CE%B4%CE%B9%CE%BF%CE%B9%CE%BA%CE%BF%CF%8D%CF%83%CE%B1%CF%82-%CE%B5%CF%80%CE%B9%CF%84%CF%81%CE%BF%CF%80%CE%AE%CF%82-%CF%84%CE%B7%CF%82-%CE%BA%CE%BF%CE%B9%CE%BD%CF%89%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%BA%CE%B7%CF%83-%CF%83%CF%85%CE%BC%CF%86%CF%89%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%B1%CF%83 |title=Notice of Executive Committee Founding Social Agreement |language=Greek|publisher=Social Agreement (koinonikisymfonia.gr)|date=7 June 2012 |accessdate=7 June 2012}} On 7 June, an arrest warrant was issued for [[Ilias Kasidiaris]] from [[Golden Dawn (Greece)|Golden Dawn]] (XA), after he during a political debate broadcast by ANT-1 TV, as reported by the newspaper Kathimerini: "threw water at SYRIZA’s [[Rena Dourou]] and then repeatedly slapped Communist Party hopeful [[Liana Kanelli]]", before the televised signal was interrupted.{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_07/06/2012_445749|title=Arrest warrant for Golden Dawn spokesman after attack during TV talk show|publisher=Ekathimerini|date=7 June 2012|accessdate=7 June 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120608223230/http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_07/06/2012_445749|archivedate=8 June 2012|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VheRFTMZV14|title=ANT1 – ΕΠΙΘΕΣΗ ΞΥΛΟΔΑΡΜΟΣ ΚΑΣΙΔΙΑΡΗ ΣΤΗΝ Λ.ΚΑΝΝΕΛΗ |language=Greek|work=Youtube|date=7 June 2012|accessdate=7 June 2012}} The [[caretaker government]] and all parties, except for the leader of Golden Dawn, jointly condemned the TV show attack by Kasidiaris with the following statements:{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_07/06/2012_445768 |title=Government, parties condemn Golden Dawn spokesman's TV show attack |publisher=Ekathimerini|date=7 June 2012|accessdate=7 June 2012}} The spokesman{{who|date=June 2012}} from the caretaker government [[Dimitris Tsiodras]] said: "This attack is an attack against every democratic citizen. The least that any democratic citizen could expect is for Mr Kasidiaris’s party, Golden Dawn, to condemn these actions unreservedly." ND, PASOK, SYRIZA and [[Independent Greeks|ANEL]] also jointly agreed, not to take part in any television or radio panel discussions with Golden Dawn candidates.{{Citation needed|date=June 2012}} An opinion poll published at 1 June by GPO, had indicated that 60% of the votes received by Golden Dawn in the May election, came from Greeks who wanted to express their opposition to the political establishment, while less than 30% of those voting for the party actually supported its extreme views on immigration. A spokesperson from PASOK said: "This young man proved today that he represents a neo-Nazi group, which apart from being far-right is also cowardly and thuggish" and called for those who previously voted for the party to "think again" before casting their June vote. ANEL leader [[Panos Kammenos]] launched the same message by saying "the neo-Nazis have been unmasked on TV. People who voted for the Nazi thugs should react when casting their vote next time."{{Citation needed|date=June 2012}} [[Popular Orthodox Rally|LAOS]]' [[Georgios Karatzaferis]], said Golden Dawn was damaging the country's patriotic front: "It took us 10 years to gain respect and dignity for the patriotic movement. We won't let the party of [[Nikolaos Michaloliakos]] and the parliamentary gang of Mr Kasidiaris to ridicule what we have built all these years. It is time for them to leave political life. Fascism will not pass in Greece."{{Citation needed|date=June 2012}} During the campaign, the 8 largest parties presented some political ultimatums about a possible government formation after the election: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;" |- ! Party name ! Ultimatums to participate in a new government formation |- | [[Recreate Greece|DX]]-[[Drasi|DRASI]]-[[Liberal Alliance (Greece)|FS]]{{cite web |url=http://www.kathimerini.gr/4dcgi/_w_articles_kathremote_1_05/06/2012_445497|title=S. Manos: "We will support the government that will fight for our stay in the eurozone" |language=Greek|publisher=Ekathimerini|date=5 June 2012|accessdate=6 June 2012}} | 1) No ultimatum. Support those offering the most ambitious Memorandum revision (with reduction of public sector, and faster speed of economic + tax + pension reforms). |- | [[Coalition of the Radical Left|SYRIZA]]{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_01/06/2012_445042|title=Tsipras sets out SYRIZA’s plan for governing – Socialist PASOK and Democratic Left slam rising leftist's economic policy proposals |publisher=Ekathimerini|date=1 June 2012|accessdate=5 June 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_01/06/2012_444972|title=Tsipras sets out SYRIZA's plan for rejecting memorandum |publisher=Ekathimerini|date=1 June 2012|accessdate=5 June 2012}} | 1) Needs to be a SYRIZA led "left government".
2) Needs to do a unilateral cancellation of the EU/IMF memorandum (without any guarantees for a continued membership of the euro).
3) Needs to implement core elements of SYRIZA's newly formulated "National Recovery Plan" (with a.o. public expenditures increased from 36% to 46% of GDP). |- | [[Golden Dawn (Greece)|XA]]{{cite web|url=http://www.xryshaygh.com/index.php/kinima/thesis |script-title=el:Χρυσή Αυγή – Λαϊκός Σύνδεσμος | Οι Θέσεις μας |language=Greek |publisher=Xryshaygh.com |accessdate=18 June 2012}} | 1) Needs to deport all illegal immigrants outside the borders of Greece.
2) Needs to do a written termination of the EU/IMF Memorandum. |} ===EU influence=== Few hours after the public announcement of the failed attempt by the Greek president to form a new government on 15 May, some Greek officials claimed that German Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] had suggested to the Greek president during a telephone call, that he should consider to launch a "euro referendum" along with the new "legislative election". The Greek media and the heads of ND, PASOK, SYRIZA, KKE, and the interim prime minister, all went out strongly to criticise that Merkel purportedly had made such advice.{{cite web|url=http://www.protothema.gr/ekloges/article/?aid=198471 |title=Πρώτο ΘΕΜΑ online : ΚΚΕ: Ωμός εκβιασμός Μέρκελ σε βάρος του ελληνικού λαού – Εκλογές 2012 |language=Greek |publisher=Protothema.gr |accessdate=26 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hv4ZTSmw9hd_hokw1cz3Fo2OfIpA?docId=CNG.73302069c1cfc1b61f105e55b53bd1ba.581 |title=AFP: Greece bridles at Merkel referendum suggestion |publisher=Google |accessdate=26 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://derstandard.at/1336697288272/Griechenland-Verwirrung-um-Merkel-Vorschlag-fuer-Euro-Referendum |title=Verwirrung um Merkel-Vorschlag für Euro-Referendum – Griechenland in der Krise|language=German|publisher=Derstandard.at |date=19 May 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012}} One day later it became clear the entire debate had been based on a translated misunderstanding, as Merkel officially denied ever to have made such a proposition to the Greek president. Merkel insisted that she said the election was "in principle...an indirect referendum on euro membership", as the outcome of the election potentially could lead to a development with Greece leaving the euro, if the election was won by parties supporting a Greek rejection of all commitments signed in the Memorandum.{{cite web|url=http://en.ria.ru/world/20120518/173543263.html |title=German Govt. Spokeswoman Denies Merkel Referendum Statement |publisher=RIA Novosti |date=18 May 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012}} British Prime Minister [[David Cameron]], representing a neutral nation outside the euro, a few days later completely agreed with Merkel's analysis, that the Greek legislative election in principle was "an indirect referendum on euro membership".{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-18139454 |title=Nick Clegg warns that Eurozone collapse will fuel 'extremism' |publisher=BBC |date=21 May 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012}} An EU summit ended on 24 May with repeated calls for Greece to stick to the terms of the EU/IMF memorandum, if they wanted to receive more funds to tackle its debt problem and current economic crisis.{{cite news|author=Mark Lowen |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18121414 |title=Merkel 'suggests Greek referendum on euro membership' |publisher=BBC |date=18 May 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/europe/2012/05/201252401643302215.html |title=EU summit ends with warning for Greece |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=4 October 2011 |accessdate=26 May 2012}} In the wake of the discussions, SYRIZA's leader Tsipras visited some of the main European cities,{{cite web|url=http://www.thomhartmann.com/forum/2012/05/greece-democracy-could-put-end-banksters%E2%80%99-austerity-experiment |title=In Greece, democracy could put an end to the banksters’ austerity experiment |publisher=Thom Hartmann |date=26 March 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012}} to clarify his stance of wishing to unilaterally cancel the Memorandum and at the same time having Greece stay within the eurozone.{{cite news|url=http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2012/05/17/tsipiras-to-amanpour-we-dont-want-greece-outside-the-euro/ |title=Tsipras to Amanpour: "We don't want Greece outside the euro..." |publisher=Cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com |accessdate=26 May 2012 |date=17 May 2012}} When the French Finance Minister [[Pierre Moscovici]] on 5 June repeated the European message that a continued euro membership was conditional on the next Greek government continuing to respect the signed commitments in the Memorandum, as the EU would only be willing to accept a re-negotiation of some subterms, Tsipras claimed this was political bluffing and a new message compared to what the French government previously had told him.{{cite web|url=http://www.kathimerini.gr/4dcgi/_w_articles_kathremote_1_04/06/2012_445261|title=Tsipras: H Greece does not turn in the Memorandum|language=Greek|publisher=Kathimerini|date=4 June 2012|accessdate=4 June 2012}} ==Results== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:right; font-size:100%;" |+ [[Greek legislative election, May 2012#Results|←]] Summary of the 17 June 2012 [[Hellenic (Greece)/meta/color}}|43.00}} {{Bar percent|SYRIZA|{{Coalition of the Radical Left/meta/color}}|23.67}} {{Bar percent|PASOK|{{Panhellenic Socialist Movement/meta/color}}|11.00}} {{Bar percent|ANEL|{{Independent Greeks/meta/color}}|6.67}} {{Bar percent|XA|{{Golden Dawn (Greece)/meta/color}}|6.00}} {{Bar percent|DIMAR|{{Democratic Left (Greece)/meta/color}}|5.67}} {{Bar percent|KKE|{{Communist Party of Greece/meta/color}}|4.00}} }} Due to unforeseen circumstances,{{clarify|date=June 2012}} voting at the 18th polling station of the Athens A' Electoral District was aborted. In accordance with Article 102 of the electoral law, a new election will be held on 24 June and the 539 registered voters will be asked to cast their ballot again.{{cite web|url=http://www1.ypes.gr/UserFiles/f0ff9297-f516-40ff-a70e-eca84e2ec9b9/egk42_19062012.pdf |accessdate=20 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150628235938/http://www.ypes.gr/UserFiles/f0ff9297-f516-40ff-a70e-eca84e2ec9b9/egk42_19062012.pdf |archivedate=28 June 2015 }} ===Reactions=== [[File:Hellenic Parliament Structure June 2012 visualizing +50 bonus.svg|thumb|right|350px|Seats won in the new parliament {{legend|blue|[[New Democracy (Greece)|New Democracy]]: 79 seats}} {{legend|#C0C0C0| > bonus 50 seats to the leading party, ND}} {{legend|#ff8080|[[Coalition of the Radical Left|Syriza Unionist Social Front]]: 71 seats}} {{legend|green|[[Panhellenic Socialist Movement]]: 33 seats}} {{legend|aqua|[[Independent Greeks]]: 20 seats}} {{legend|#00022D|[[Golden Dawn (Greece)|Golden Dawn]]: 18 seats}} {{legend|orangered|[[Democratic Left (Greece)|Democratic Left]]: 17 seats}} {{legend|red|[[Communist Party of Greece|Communist Party]]: 12 seats}}]] [[Eurozone]] finance ministers were quick to issue a statement that read the result "should allow for the formation of a government that will carry the support of the electorate to bring Greece back on a path of sustainable growth...The Eurogroup reiterates its commitment to assist Greece in its adjustment effort in order to address the many challenges the economy is facing." It also said the "troika" of the European Commission, European Central Bank and International Monetary Fund would re-visit Athens to continue discussions on the bailout agreement.[http://www.consilium.europa.eu/uedocs/cms_Data/docs/pressdata/en/ecofin/131027.pdf Eurogroup statement on 2012 Greek elections] On his way to the [[2012 G-20 Mexico summit]], British Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] warned of delayed government formation and said that "the outcome of the Greek election looks clear in terms of a commitment to stay in the eurozone and to accept the terms of the memorandum. But I think those parties that want that to happen can't afford to delay and position themselves. If you are a Greek political party and want to stay in the eurozone and accept the consequences that follow you have got to get on with it and help form a government. A delay could be very dangerous." European Union President [[Herman Van Rompuy]] issued a statement that read: "We will continue to stand by Greece." He added that "we are confident that the new government will take ownership of the adjustment program to which the Greek authorities had committed earlier this year." [[European Commission]] President [[Jose Manuel Barroso]] reiterated a willingness to visit Greece when a new government is formed to keep the country on track to continue receiving the bailout money.{{cite news|last=Baker |first=Luke |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/06/18/us-g20-europe-vanrompuy-idUSBRE85H1AQ20120618 |title=EU confident Greece will adhere to bailout: Van Rompuy |publisher=Reuters |date= 18 June 2012|accessdate=3 July 2012}} New Democracy's Antonis Samaras said that "there’s no time to lose or leeway for small party games. The country must be governed." PASOK's Evangelos Venizelos said that "there's not even a day to lose" in the need to form a new government.{{cite news|last=Stearns |first=Jonathan |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-06-17/greece-races-as-cash-dwindles-with-europe-seeking-return-to-cuts.html |title=Greece Races as Cash Dwindles With Europe Seeking Return to Cuts |publisher=Bloomberg |accessdate=18 June 2012 |date=18 June 2012}} Samaras also said the election was a mandate to stay within the eurozone.{{cite web|author=John Psaropoulos |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/06/2012618102935771328.html |title=Greece results bring relief but no remedy - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date= |accessdate=18 June 2012}} Golden Dawn's [[Nikolaos Michaloliakos]] said that he "would like to thank the hundreds of thousands of Greeks who did not change their vote, despite the effort of wretched propaganda by the paid stooges on TV. We will continue the fight for a Greece that belongs to Greeks." In [[Thessaloniki]], Golden Dawn's supporters celebrated the result and set off flares and fireworks. The following day, [[financial market]]s initially rose on the news of ND's plurality, but later came down as the possible implications became known.{{cite news|author=G20 summit |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/g20-summit/9338840/G20-summit-Greece-must-get-on-with-it-or-face-dangerous-consequences-warns-David-Cameron.html |title=G20 summit: Greece must 'get on with it' or face dangerous consequences, warns David Cameron |publisher=Telegraph |date= 18 June 2012|accessdate=18 June 2012 |location=London}} On 19 June, European and American financial markets rose on speculation of the imminence of a new government that would have at least a modicum of support for the bailout programme.{{cite news|last=Nazareth |first=Rita |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-06-19/u-s-stock-index-futures-fluctuate-citigroup-falls.html |title=U.S. Stocks Advance to One-Month High as Fed Meets |publisher=Bloomberg |date=19 June 2012 |accessdate=3 July 2012}} ==Results by region== {|class="wikitable" |- style="background-color:#E9E9E9"1 ! 4.89 || 4.33 || 3.35 |- | align="left"| Zakynthos || 28.34 || '''34.74''' || 11.73 || 4.09 || 5.54 || 4.21 || 7.56 |} ==Analysis== The ''[[Huffington Post]]'' read Golden Dawn's popularity as a "symptom of the alienation and hardship that their society is experiencing."{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/17/golden-dawn-election-results_n_1604097.html |title=Golden Dawn, Greek Far Right Party, Returns To Parliament |work=Huffington Post |accessdate=18 June 2012 |date=17 June 2012}} The statement was echoed by ''[[Fox News]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2012/06/17/greece-far-right-party-returns-to-parliament/ |title=Greece: far-right party returns to parliament |publisher=Fox News |date=7 April 2010 |accessdate=18 June 2012}} The ''[[BBC]]'' cited Greece's [[debt-to-GDP ratio]] and forecasts to ask if an exit from the eurozone was only delayed.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-18489360 |title=BBC News - Greece: Euro exit delayed? |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=1 January 1970 |accessdate=18 June 2012}} ''[[Al Jazeera]]'' said the May election was a vote out of anger over the austerity measures, but that this was a vote out of fear after the in terms of a more defined future. It cited Samaras' question of staying within the eurozone or returning to the [[drachma]].{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/blog/europe/why-greeks-voted-way-they-did |title=Why Greeks voted the way they did | Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.com |date= |accessdate=18 June 2012}} It also asked if a "Grexit" (Greek exit) from the eurozone was inevitable and cited this as Europe's "Lehman moment" in reference to the [[bankruptcy of Lehman Brothers]]. It further cited the [[Royal Bank of Scotland]]'s assertion that there was a 90 percent chance of a Greek exit from the eurozone within 12–18 months, while [[Citigroup]] estimated a 50-75 percent chance of an exit. [[UBS]] suggested a [[write off]] of 60 billion euros of Greece's debts, as opposed to a between 225 billion to 800 billion euros if Greece were to leave the eurozone. Greece was already expected to be unable to pay pensions and civil servant salaries by mid-July should there be no more external funds coming into the country.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/blog/europe/why-grexit-inevitable |title=Why 'Grexit' is inevitable | Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.com |date= |accessdate=18 June 2012}} ''[[Foreign Affairs]]'' suggested that the election determined whether Greece would exit the eurozone and decide the fate of the entire postwar European project.{{cite web|author=Stathis N. Kalyvas |url=http://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/137710/stathis-n-kalyvas/greece-votes-itself-in-the-foot |title=Greece Votes Itself in the Foot |publisher=Foreign Affairs |date=12 June 2012 |accessdate=18 June 2012}}{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/18/world/europe/greek-elections.html?_r=1&ref=world | work=The New York Times | first=Rachel | last=Donadio | title=Greece Pro-Bailout Party Wins Election | date=17 June 2012}} ==Government formation== {{main|Cabinet of Antonis Samaras}} New Democracy announced it was working towards building a "pro-euro" coalition.{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/europe/2012/06/201261716157457770.html |title=Pro-euro parties clinch Greek polls – Europe |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=4 October 2011 |accessdate=18 June 2012}} The next day Samaras was tasked with forming a new government within the stipulated three days.{{cite news|author=Chris Morris |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-18490930 |title=BBC News - Antonis Samaras begins urgent Greece coalition talks |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=1 January 1970 |accessdate=18 June 2012}} SYRIZA announced that it would not join a coalition government which would include a party that insists on going ahead with the austerity measures demanded by the "troika." However, PASOK's Evangelos Venizelos met with Samaras and then announced that "the most crucial thing for us right now is to achieve the greatest possible range of consensus, and this must happen by [19 June] at the latest;" he then went on to criticise Tsipras' refusal to join the government in saying that "you can't have some people choosing the easy position of being in opposition and lying in wait for the government to fail - or rather trying to create the conditions for the government, that is the country, to fail."{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/europe/2012/06/2012618173626287447.html |title=Greek leader seeks 'salvation' government - Europe |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date= |accessdate=3 July 2012}} On 19 June, ND suggested it was on the verge of forming a coalition government with PASOK and DIMAR, though the latter's Fotis Kouvelis said that he would only offer conditional support. The same morning Samaras met with Kouvelis to gauge support for a three-party coalition. ''[[Ta Nea]]'' exclaimed in an [[op-ed]] that "political leaders should be aware of the fact that this government is Greece's last chance to remain in the eurozone. The Greek people are ready to reward the parties that manage to ease austerity and punish those that raise voices of dissent."{{cite news|author=Reuters 19 June 2012, 01.05PM IST |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international-business/greece-elections-conservative-new-democracy-poised-to-clinch-coalition-deal-with-pasok/articleshow/14265425.cms |title=Greece elections: Conservative New Democracy poised to clinch coalition deal with PASOK - Economic Times |publisher=Economictimes.indiatimes.com |date=19 June 2012 |accessdate=3 July 2012}} ND then claimed to have a preliminary agreement with PASOK in order to form a [[national unity government|government of national salvation]]. On 20 June, ND announced a coalition government with PASOK and DIMAR after resuming talks for a common policy programme. Greek media speculated on who would be in the cabinet, including suggestions that the Finance Ministry portfolio would be given to [[Vassilis Rapanos]], the president of [[National Bank of Greece]]. PASOK and DIMAR were said to limit their participitation in a new government so as not to be responsible for its actions. They also opposed the inclusion of cabinet members who were previously in the government that approved the bailout programme. Kouvelis said that DIMAR's conditions for joining the coalition government would include an extension of the timetable to meet the target to cut Greece's budget deficit, as well as cutting the [[minimum wage]] and revoking the austerity measures that had "decimated society."{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/21/world/europe/greece-poised-to-form-new-coalition.html | work=The New York Times | first1=Rachel | last1=Donadio | first2=Liz | last2=Alderman | title=Antonis Samaras Is Sworn In as Greek Prime Minister | date=20 June 2012}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.igraphics.gr/en/multimedia/2012/06/elections2012b igraphics.gr], election results visualized. Distribution maps of every party for further analysis. {{Greek elections}} [[Category:Greek legislative elections, 2012|June]] [[Category:Parliamentary elections in Greece|2012-2]] [[Category:2012 in Greek politics]] [[Category:Greek government-debt crisis]] [[Category:June 2012 events in Europe]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Healtheon Corporation | fate = Acquired by [[WebMD]] | foundation = {{start date and age|1996}} | founder = [[James H. Clark]]
Pavan Nigam | defunct = {{start date and age|1999}} | location = [[Santa Clara, California]] }} '''Healtheon''' was a [[dot-com company]] founded by [[James H. Clark]] and Pavan Nigam. The company's mission was to "use the power of computing and the [[Internet]] to revolutionize the [[healthcare industry]], stripping away its inefficiencies and inequities and streamlining it for the new millennium".{{cite news | url=http://archive.fortune.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/2000/02/21/273905/index.htm | title=What the Heck is Healtheon? | first=Julie | last=Creswell | work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] | date=February 21, 2000}} In 1999, the company was acquired by [[WebMD]]. ==History== In mid-1995, [[James H. Clark]], the founder of [[Netscape]], came up with the idea to modernize technology in the health care industry. He founded Healthscape in early 1996 with funding from [[Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers]]. To avoid confusion with Netscape, the company changed its name to Healtheon.{{cite news | url=https://www.sfgate.com/business/article/Another-Startup-by-Jim-Clark-New-online-venture-2977549.php | title=Another Startup by Jim Clark / New online venture focuses on health care | first=Jon | last=Swartz | work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] | date=June 18, 1996}} The company's first big idea was to develop a system for linking insurers and [[human resources]] departments. However, the idea failed since insurers dismissed it as too expensive and human resource departments were not interested. In 1997, [[Mike Long (American businessman)|Mike Long]] became [[chief executive officer]] of the company. Five months later, the company formed a [[research and development]] partnership with Brown & Toland, a network of 1,600 physicians in [[San Francisco]]. in February 1998, the company announced the acquisition of ActaMed, a medical-records clearinghouse for doctors and insurers, for $150 million, which gave the company a source of revenue.{{cite news | url=http://articles.latimes.com/1998/feb/26/business/fi-23067 | title=Healtheon to Buy ActaMed for $150 Million | agency=[[Bloomberg News]] | publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]] | date=February 26, 1998}}{{cite news | url=https://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/stories/1998/02/23/daily11.html | title=Healtheon to buy ActaMed Corp. | work=[[American City Business Journals]] | date=February 25, 1998}} In August 1998, the company filed for an [[initial public offering]], but the offering was cancelled in October 1998, after stock prices dropped due to the [[1998 Russian financial crisis]].{{cite news | url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB908916747713453000 | title=Healtheon Cancels Planned Offering, Will Raise $40 Million From Backers | first=George | last=Anders | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=October 21, 1998}}{{subscription required}} In February 1999, the company completed its IPO and became a [[public company]] and the stock price rose 400% on its first day of trading. On April 21, 1999, the company announced the acquisition of MedE America for $478 million in stock.{{cite press release | url=http://investor.shareholder.com/wbmd/releasedetail.cfm?releaseid=249527&CompanyID=HLTH | title=Healtheon to Acquire MEDE AMERICA | date=April 21, 1999}}{{cite news | url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB924717840641032784 | title=Healtheon Agrees to Buy Mede America In Stock Deal Valued at $478.5 Million | first=Don | last=Clark | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=April 22, 1999}}{{subscription required}} On May 20, 1999, the company announced a merger with [[WebMD]].{{cite press release | url=http://investor.shareholder.com/wbmd/releasedetail.cfm?releaseid=249524&CompanyID=HLTH | title=Healtheon and WebMD Announce Merger to Form first End-to-End Internet Healthcare and E-Commerce Company | date=May 20, 1999}} ==References== {{Reflist|1}} [[Category:1996 establishments in California]] [[Category:1999 initial public offerings]] [[Category:1999 mergers and acquisitions]] [[Category:Defunct online companies of the United States]] [[Category:Defunct software companies of the United States]] [[Category:Dot-com bubble]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox Website | name = HotBot | logo = Hotbot logo.png | logo_size = 200px | screenshot = | caption = HotBot logo since 2011 | commercial = | language = [[English language]] | type = [[Web search engine]] | owner = [[Lycos]] | launch date = {{start date and age|1996|5}} | alexa = {{IncreaseNegative}} 267,802 ({{as of|2017|4|12}})<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/hotbot.com |title= Hotbot.com Site Info | publisher=[[Alexa Internet]]}}</ref> | current status = Active | url = [http://www.hotbot.com/ HotBot.com] }}
'''HotBot''' was a [[metasearch engine]] for information on the [[world wide web]]. It is now a privately owned front end using [[Bing (search engine)|Bing search]] for its search results.
==History== Hotbot was launched in May 1996 by [[Wired (magazine)|''Wired'' magazine]]. It became a popular tool with search results served by the [[Inktomi (company)|Inktomi]] database and directory results provided originally by [[LookSmart]] and then [[DMOZ]] since mid-1999. Hotbot also used search data from Direct Hit for a period, which was a tool that used click-through data to manipulate results. It was launched using a "new links" strategy of marketing, claiming to update its search database more often than its competitors. It also offered free webpage hosting, but only for a short time, and it was taken down without any notice to its users. It was one of the first search engines to offer the ability to search within search results.
[[Lycos]] acquired HotBot as part of its acquisition of Wired in 1998 and thereafter HotBot languished with limited development and falling market share. At the end of 2002 HotBot was relaunched as a multiple option search tool, giving users the option to search either the [[Fast Search & Transfer|FAST]], [[Google]], [[Inktomi (company)|Inktomi]] or [[Teoma]] databases.<ref>[http://www.websearchworkshop.co.uk/hotbot_history.php HotBot: A brief history of the HotBot search engine]</ref>
Up to 2011, the HotBot website was merely a [[Front and back ends|front end]] for three third-party search engines ([[Yahoo.com]], [[MSN Search|MSN]], and lyGo.com). In July 2011, HotBot was relaunched with a new robot-like mascot, a new logo, and a modern site design. In the beta, HotBot became a portal, returning not just web search results, but also searches from various Lycos websites, such as News, Shopping and [[Weather Zombie]]. The portal interface lasted for roughly six months, and these features were instead reincorporated into the 2012 Lycos website redesign, returning HotBot to a simplified search interface.
In October 2016, Lycos sold the Hotbot.com domain name for $155,000 to an unnamed buyer.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://domainnamewire.com/2016/10/04/lycos-sells-hotbot-com-155000/ | title=Lycos sells HotBot.com for $155,000 | first=ANDREW | last=ALLEMANN | publisher=Domain Name Wire | date=October 4, 2016}}</ref>
==Toolbar launch in 2004== In early 2004, Lycos launched a beta release of a free toolbar search product, Lycos HotBot DeskTop, which the company said was "the first product to integrate traditional desktop search with Web search within the browser." The HotBot DeskTop could search the Internet using Inktomi, e-mail folders for [[Microsoft Outlook]] or [[Outlook Express]], and user documents stored on a hard drive. It also incorporated a blocker for pop-up ads and an RSS News Reader syndication. Indexes created to track e-mail and user files remained stored locally to protect user privacy. Text-based ads were displayed when viewing results for several types of Internet searches. Lycos licensed [[DtSearch Corp.|dtSearch]] technology to power the local search options.<ref>[http://newsbreaks.infotoday.com/nbreader.asp?ArticleID=16488 Lycos HotBot Offers Free DeskTop Toolbar - March, 2004 ]</ref>
==References== <references />
== External links == * [http://www.hotbot.com/ HotBot]
{{Lycos}}
[[Category:Internet search engines]] [[Category:Metasearch engines]] [[Category:Dot-com bubble]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 1996]]

revision.text:
[[File:North Korea — Pyongyang Opera.jpg|thumb|An opera performance in [[Pyongyang]]]]
'''Korean revolutionary opera''' is a tradition of [[revolutionary opera]] in [[North Korea]] based on that of [[China]] during the [[Cultural Revolution]]. It is characterized by a highly melodramatic style and reoccurring themes of [[Korean nationalism]] and glorification of [[socialism]], the [[Kim dynasty (North Korea)|Kim dynasty]], and the working people, as well as a focus on [[socialist realism|socialist realist]] themes. Composers of North Korean revolutionary opera are employed by the [[North Korean government]] and the fundamental principles of North Korean revolutionary opera were dictated by [[Kim Jong-Il]] in his speech (later transcribed to book) ''On the Art of Opera''.
==History==
North Korean revolutionary opera was preceded by the spread of [[juche]] propaganda songs that praised [[Kim Il-Sung]] and the nation, which itself replaced [[p'ansori]] – traditional Korean theatrical song.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Yu|first1=Yongmin|title=Musical Performance of Korean Identities in North Korea, South Korea, Japan, and the United States|issue=University of Southern California, (thesis)|page=25}}</ref> North Korean revolutionary opera was highly influenced by the original form of revolutionary opera developed as part of the Chinese Cultural Revolution, including such works as ''Taking Tiger Mountain by Strategy'' and ''The Legend of the Red Lantern''. North Korean studies scholar Alzo David-West writes that "Three of the alleged North Korean innovations in its national socialist realist musical theater are dynamic three-dimensional stage settings, stanzaic songs based on peasant-folk music, and pangchang (an off-stage singing chorus), which in anti–Brechtian fashion constructs emotional links between character and spectator and controls the audience's interpretation of events. These appear in Maoist revolutionary opera".<ref>David-West, A. (2006). "Nationalist Allegory in North Korea: The Revolutionary Opera ''Sea of Blood''". ''North Korean Review'', 75.</ref> However, North Korean revolutionary opera differed in several ways, most notably in its use of traditional Korean instruments alongside Western orchestral ones, and its permitting the display of romantic love and supernatural or magical elements, both of which were banned in Cultural Revolution-era China.<ref>Sheila Melvin, "North Korean Opera Draws Acclaim in China", ''New York Times'' (online), retrieved 2015-11-15</ref>
The first revolutionary opera in North Korea, ''[[Sea of Blood]]'', was premiered at the [[Pyongyang Grand Theatre]] in July 1971, with Kim Il-Sung credited as the author and Kim Jong-Il credited as producer.<ref>David-West, 76</ref> The opera is seen as the primary example of North Korean revolutionary opera, with many North Korean texts referring to revolutionary opera as "Sea of Blood-style" opera. Sea of Blood was adapted from a 1969 film of the same name. Kim Il-Sung claimed to have written it with his comrades in a [[Chinese Communist Party]] (CCP) guerilla unit while fighting against the Japanese in occupied [[Manchuria]], and performed it on a makeshift stage in a recently liberated village as a form of anti-colonial [[propaganda]].<ref name="David-West, 78">David-West, 78</ref> However, the veracity of this claim is disputed due to the difficulty of finding accurate information about Kim Il-Sung's early life and guerilla career.
Sea of Blood was followed by the rest of the "Five Great Revolutionary Operas": ''[[The Flower Girl]]'', ''Tell O' the Forest!'', ''A True Daughter of the Party'', and ''The Song of Mount Kumgang''.The five plays have been performed consistently at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre since their respective debuts, with Sea of Blood and The Flower Girl both having been performed over 1,000 times each.
Revolutionary opera flourished in North Korea as Kim Jong-Il began to take charge of many aspects of the country, particularly its arts and propaganda programs. In September 1974, Kim Jong-Il gave a "Talk to Creative Workers in the Field of Art and Literature" entitled "On the Art of Opera", in which he described the most important principles of North Korean opera according to the regime. According to Kim, because opera combines music, dance, poetry, and theatre, it "constitutes a criterion for evaluating the level of a country".<ref name=Kim>{{cite book|last1=Il|first1=Kim-Jong|title=On the Art of Opera|date=2001|publisher=University Press of the Pacific}}</ref> A good revolutionary opera must reflect the time it was produced in, and be guided "strictly by revolutionary principles".<ref>Kim, 4</ref> Revolutionary opera must also be emotionally affecting to the audience and be composed of beautifully poetic words and music.
New operas modeled after the five great revolutionary operas are continuing to be produced in North Korea. The operas have been performed outside of North Korea, with ''Sea of Blood'' and ''The Flower Girl'' gaining widespread popularity in China. ''Sea of Blood'' was performed on a two-month tour of China in May to July 2010, with many of the performances selling out.<ref>Melvin, retrieved 11-15-2015</ref>
==Form==
The writers, actors, and directors of North Korean revolutionary opera, under the guiding hands of Kim Il-Sung and Kim Jong-Il, were instructed to produce an opera that was distinctly North Korean and distinctly different than previous forms of opera. According to Kim Jong-Il, "The operatic style of feudalism or capitalism cannot serve the creation of operas for the working class who are now building socialism and communism, nor can the imitation of foreign things help in producing operas that cater to the aesthetic tastes and feelings of our people".<ref>Kim, 8</ref>
North Korean revolutionary opera, being a form of [[socialist realism]], deals near-exclusively in political subject matter, extolling the virtues of the working [[proletariat]], the glory of the communist struggle, and the greatness of the Kim dynasty. Most are set in the formative period of the DPRK – either the [[Japanese occupation of Korea]] or the Korean War. The songs of North Korean revolutionary opera, unlike those of Western opera, are stanzaic in form, with main melodies often being repeated. This is in keeping with the aims of North Korean opera to be "a true art for the people",<ref>Kim, 42</ref> as Kim Jong-Il states in On the Art of Opera. In order for opera to be able to reach the maximum number of people, throughout all of North Korea and beyond, the songs must be memorable and easily repeated, "composed in such a way that anybody can understand and sing", according to Kim.<ref>Kim, 9</ref>
Also central to North Korean revolutionary opera is the ''pangchang'', or off-stage song, describing the situation of the characters and their innermost thoughts and feelings. For example, in ''Sea of Blood'', the pangchang "The Mother Learns to Read and Write" is sung from offstage as the actor playing the mother is onstage performing the actions described. The song comments on the action and sings the praises of the mother as an ideal communist and North Korean heroine. Kim Jong-Il describes the pangchang as "a powerful means of portrayal not present in the operas of the past",<ref>Kim, 10</ref> but the originality of the pangchang is disputed, as scholars such as Alzo David-West have found similar innovations in Maoist revolutionary opera, as well as an obvious precedent in the chorus in classical Greek tragedy.<ref name="David-West, 78"/>
North Korean revolutionary opera makes heavy use of [[dance]] as well as singing, with performances often incorporating elaborate dances in the most important scenes to show both the action onstage and the characters' feelings. These dances are typically based on a long tradition of [[Korean folk dance]], one of the few examples of a folk tradition that has remained relatively intact since the formation of the DPRK.
[[Theatrical scenery|Sets]] and backdrops must be realistic and three-dimensional, and are typically lavish and elaborate, eschewing abstraction for reproduction of real life elements. However, sets must not only be a realistic approximation of the location, but also "describe the personality of the character living and working in that society", according to ''On the Art of Opera''.<ref>Kim,79</ref> The same principles are applied to [[makeup]], [[Theatrical property|props]], and [[costume|costuming]].
North Korean revolutionary opera is typically performed with a mix of Western classical instruments and [[traditional Korean instruments]], a style christened the "combined orchestra" (''paehap kwanhydnak'').<ref>Yu,101</ref> In this, it is important that Korean instruments take precedence over Western ones, in order to ensure a distinctly Korean opera and to stay aligned with the values of the juche ideology.
==The Five Great Revolutionary Operas==
=== ''Sea of Blood''=== {{Main|Sea of Blood}} The most famous North Korean revolutionary opera, ''[[Sea of Blood]]'' dramatizes the struggle of a Korean mother and her family in Japanese-occupied Manchuria in the 1930s, where Kim Il-Sung was a guerilla fighter. The family is subject to many horrors under the Japanese regime, before they finally join the Communist revolution and destroy their oppressors. The title refers to the actions of the Japanese army which the hero describes as having "turned the country into the sea of blood".<ref name="North Korea's Revolutionary Operas">{{cite web|title=North Korea's Revolutionary Operas|url=http://www.nkeconwatch.com/2009/04/22/north-koreas-revolutionary-operas/|website=North Korean Economy Watch|accessdate=2015-11-15}}</ref>
===''The Flower Girl''=== {{Main|The Flower Girl}} ''[[The Flower Girl]]'' is also set during the Japanese occupation in the 1930s, though in Korea itself, not Manchuria. It tells the story of a poor flower-seller and her struggle against a greedy landlord, who is eventually overthrown by the people. It was also made into film.
===''Tell O' The Forest''=== ''{{ill|Tell O' The Forest!|ko|밀림아 이야기하라}}'' is the story of Choe Byong Hung, a revolutionary who pretends to serve the Japanese during the occupation, but suffers the anger of the people of his village, who find his deception too convincing. His daughter commits suicide due to the shame of being "daughter of the puppet village head", after which Choe lures the Japanese forces into a trap in which he too perishes.
Tell O' The Forest was criticized by Kim Jong-Il in ''On the Art of Opera'' for having the hero die before witnessing the moment of victory, as well as sticking to the "outmoded pattern" of using exclusively song, not a mixture of song and speech.<ref>Kim,35</ref>
===''A True Daughter of the Party''=== ''{{ill|A True Daughter of the Party|ko|당의 참된 딸}}'' is set during the Korean War, and follows Nurse Kang Yong Ok, a nurse and woman soldier against the American forces under the banner of the [[Korean People's Army]]. The main theme, "Dear General, Where Are You", is a paean to General Kim Il-Sung. (Kim Jong-Il himself composed the piece.)
===''The Song of Mount Kumgang''=== Again set during and after the Japanese occupation, ''{{ill|The Song of Mount Kumgang|ko|금강산의 노래}}'' tells the story of a family separated during the occupation who reunite twenty years later and live a joyful life under the new communist system. According to the DPRK description, "The opera represents the transformation of the mountain area, once worthless under the Japanese oppression, into the people's paradise through the portrayal of the local girls' joyful life and the hero Hwang's personal experience".<ref name="North Korea's Revolutionary Operas"/>
==See also== * [[List of North Korean operas]] * [[Music of North Korea]] * [[Revolutionary opera]]
==Notes== {{reflist}}
{{Music of Korea}}

{{Infobox pro wrestling championship | championshipname=''Leyenda de Azul'' | image = Mascara Blue Demon.svg | image_size =200px | caption = The mask of [[Blue Demon]], which the tournament honors | currentholder=[[Rush (wrestler)|Rush]] | won=December 22,2017 | promotion=[[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] | created=October 27, 2000 | mostreigns=No multiple champions | firstchamp=[[Blue Panther]] | longestreign= | shortestreign= | heaviest= | lightest= }} The '''''Leyenda de Azul''''' ([[Spanish language|Spanish]] for "the Blue Legend") is a [[lucha libre]] [[tournament]] held seven times by the [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[professional wrestling promotion]] [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] (CMLL) between 2000 and 2008 and again in 2011 and 2012. The tournament honors [[Blue Demon]], or ''Demonio Azul'' as he's sometimes referred to. The tournament is not nearly as prestigious as CMLL's annual ''[[Leyenda de Plata]]'' tournament. The winner is given a plaque with a Blue Demon mask on it and a championship belt featuring Blue Demon as well. All tournaments have taken place in [[Arena México]] in [[Mexico City]] and all were held on Fridays during CMLL's [[CMLL Super Viernes|Super Viernes]] show. In 2009 [[Blue Demon Jr.]] threatened to take legal action against CMLL on behalf of the [[National Wrestling Alliance]] over CMLL's use of three NWA branded championships.{{cite web | url=http://www.record.com.mx/tmf/demon-desconoce-fajines-del-cmll-03032010.html | title= Demon desconoce fajines CMLL de Texano y Averno | author=Cáliz, David | date= March 3, 2010 | publisher= Record.com.mx | language=Spanish}} While CMLL did not publicly respond to the threat they dropped the tournament from their schedule for two years. In July 2011, CMLL, still not on good terms with Blue Demon Jr., announced the return of the tournament. The tournament would instead be endorsed by Blue Demon's biological son and Blue Demon Jr.'s adopted brother, El Hijo de Blue Demon. ==Tournament winners== {| class="wikitable sortable" !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Year !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Winner !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Defeated !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Date !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Note |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2000|2000]] |[[Blue Panther]] |Unknown |{{dts|2000|10|27}} |{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2000 | title= Leyenda de Azul 2000 | date= October 27, 2000 | accessdate= June 11, 2010 | publisher= ProWrestlingHistory.com}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2003|2003]] |[[Tarzan Boy (wrestler)|Tarzan Boy]] |[[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]] |{{dts|2003|8|8}} |{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2003 | title= Leyenda de Azul 2000 | date= August 8, 2003 | accessdate= June 11, 2010 | publisher= ProWrestlingHistory.com}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2004|2004]] |[[Universo 2000]] |[[Canek (wrestler)|Canek]] |{{dts|2004|10 |8}} |{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2004 | title= Leyenda de Azul 2000 | date= October 8, 2004 | accessdate= June 11, 2010 | publisher= ProWrestlingHistory.com}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2005|2005]] |[[Lizmark Jr.]] |[[Último Guerrero]] |{{dts|2005|7|15}} |{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2005 | title= Leyenda de Azul 2000 | date= July 15, 2005 | accessdate= June 11, 2010 | publisher= ProWrestlingHistory.com}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2006|2006]] |[[Rey Bucanero]] |[[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]] |{{dts|2006|11|3}} |{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2006 | title= Leyenda de Azul 2000 | date= November 3, 2006 | accessdate= June 11, 2010 | publisher= ProWrestlingHistory.com}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2008|2008]] |[[El Terrible]] |[[Marco Corleone]] |{{dts|2008|12|12}} |{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2008 | title= Leyenda de Azul 2000 | date= December 12, 2008 | accessdate= June 11, 2010 | publisher= ProWrestlingHistory.com}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2011|2011]] |[[Mr. Niebla]] |[[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]] |{{dts|2011|7|29}} |{{cite web | 2011 | work=[[Récord]] | language=Spanish}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2012|2012]] |[[Diamante Azul]] |[[Último Guerrero]] |{{dts|2012|10|12}} | |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2014|2014]] |[[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]] |[[Último Guerrero]] |{{dts|2014|6|20}} | |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2016|2016]] |[[Último Guerrero]] |[[Valiente (wrestler)|Valiente]] |{{dts|2016|11|18}} |{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/lucha-libre/2016/11/20/ultimo-guerrero-nuevo-monarca-de-la-leyenda-azul | title=Último Guerrero, nuevo Monarca de la Leyenda Azul | date=November 20, 2016 | accessdate=November 24, 2016 | work=MedioTiempo | publisher=[[MSN]] | language=Spanish}} |- |[[#Leyenda de Azul 2017|2017]] |[[Rush (wrestler)|Rush]] |[[Euforia (wrestler)|Euforia]] |{{dts|2017|12|22}} |{{cite web | url = http://cmll.com/?p=123338 | archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/6vvLIFJwy?url=http://cmll.com/?p=123338 | title = Resultados Viernes Arena México: ¡Rush se lleva la Leyenda Azul! | archivedate=December 23, 2017 | date=December 22, 2017 | accessdate=December 23, 2017 | work=[[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] | language=Spanish}} |} ==Leyenda de Azul 2000== {{Infobox wrestling event |name=''Leyenda de Azul'' (2000) |image=Blue-Panther.jpg |caption=[[Blue Panther]], first ever tournament winner |promotion = [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] |date=October 27, 2000 |attendance= |venue=[[Arena Mexico]] |city = [[Mexico City, Mexico]] |liveevent=Y |lastevent=[[CMLL 67th Anniversary Show]] |nextevent=''[[Sin Piedad (2000)|Sin Piedad]]'' (2000) |event=''Leyenda de Azul'' |lastevent2=First |nextevent2=''[[Leyenda de Azul#Leyenda de Azul 2003|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2003) }} The first ''Leyenda de Azul'' tournament took place on October 27, 2000, just 21 days after the 2000 version of the ''Leyenda de Plata'' tournament. 16 men competed in a ''[[Torneo cibernetico]]'' match for the trophy. Only the second half of the match was shown on television, which means that the order of the first eight eliminations is only known to the people in attendance at [[Arena México]] that night. The first eight are listed alphabetically. During the match [[Máscara Año 2000]] allowed himself to get pinned by [[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]] while he himself had Shocker pinned to ensure that Shocker was eliminated from the tournament. [[Blue Panther]] won the ''torneo cibernetico'' when he pinned [[Mr. Niebla]].{{cite news | author = Box y Lucha staff | title = 2000 Especial! | work = Box y Lucha Magazine | pages= 2–20 | id = issue 2488 | date = January 9, 2001 | language = Spanish}}{{cite web | url=http://www.canoe.ca/SlamWrestlingInternational/mexico_timeline-can.html | title=SLAM! Wrestling International -- 2000: The Year-In-Review Mexico | accessdate=July 31, 2015 | work=Slam Wrestling! | publisher=Canoe.ca}} {| class="wikitable sortable" !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=5%|# !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=40%|Eliminated !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=40%|Eliminated by !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=15%|Time |- |# |[[Brazo de Plata]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |# |[[Bestia Salvaje]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |# |[[Cien Caras]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |# |[[Emilio Charles Jr.]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |# |[[Lizmark Jr.]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |# |[[Perro Aguayo]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |# |[[Rayo de Jalisco Jr.]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |# |[[Villano IV]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |9 |[[Apolo Dantés]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |10 |[[Villano III]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |11 |[[Universo 2000]] |''Unknown'' |  |- |12 |[[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]] |[[Máscara Año 2000]]
(double pin) |  |- |13 |[[Máscara Año 2000]] |[[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]]
(double pin) |  |- |14 |[[El Satánico]] |[[Mr. Niebla]] |  |- |15 |[[Mr. Niebla]] |[[Blue Panther]] |  |- |16 |'''Winner''' |[[Blue Panther]] |  |} ==Leyenda de Azul 2003== {{Infobox wrestling event |name=''Leyenda de Azul'' (2003) |image=LuchaLibreObrera065.JPG |caption=[[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]], last man eliminated in the tournament |promotion = [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] |date=August 8, 2003 |attendance= |venue=[[Arena Mexico]] |city = [[Mexico City, Mexico]] |liveevent=Y |lastevent=[[CMLL International Gran Prix#International Gran Prix 2003|International Gran Prix (2003)]] |nextevent=[[CMLL 70th Anniversary Show]] |event=''Leyenda de Azul'' |lastevent2=''[[Leyenda de Azul#Leyenda de Azul 2000|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2000) |nextevent2=''[[Leyenda de Azul#Leyenda de Azul 2004|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2004) }} CMLL did not hold a ''Leyenda de Azul'' in 2001 or 2002 but did promote the tournament in 2003. Like the first ''Leyenda de Azul'', the second version also centered around a 16-man ''Torneo cibernetico'' match. The match came down to [[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]] and [[Tarzan Boy (wrestler)|Tarzan Boy]], at the time both mid-card wrestlers hoping to move into the main event picture. Tarzan Boy pinned Shocker to win the 2003 ''Leyenda de Azul'' trophy.{{cite news | author = SuperLuchas staff | title = Número Especial - Lo mejor de la lucha libre mexicana durante el 2003 | work = Super Luchas | id = issue 40 | date = January 5, 2003 | language = Spanish}} {| class="wikitable sortable" !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=5%|# !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=40%|Eliminated 2003|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2003) |nextevent2=''[[Leyenda de Azul#Leyenda de Azul 2005|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2005) }} The third ''Leyenda de Azul'' tournament took place on October 8, 2004 and like the two previous ''Leyenda de Azul'' tournaments featured a 16-man ''torneo cibernetico''. The final two wrestlers in the match were [[Canek (wrestler)|Canek]] and [[Universo 2000]]. Universo 2000 pinned Canek to win the tournament, gaining a small measure of revenge on the man that beat him for his mask only three weeks prior at the [[CMLL 71st Anniversary Show]].{{cite news | author = SuperLuchas staff | title = Número Especial - Lo mejor de la lucha libre mexicana durante el 2004 | work = Super Luchas | id = issue 91 | date = January 24, 2005 | language = Spanish}} {| class="wikitable sortable" !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=5%|# !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=40%|Eliminated !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=40%|Eliminated by !style="background: #e3e3e3;" width=15%|Time |- |1 |[[Apolo Dantés]] |[[Brazo de Plata]] |11:12 |- |2 |[[Máscara Sagrada]] |[[Cien Caras]] |12:57 |- |3 |[[El Satánico]] |[[Héctor Garza]] |13:50 |- |4 |[[Cien Caras]] |[[Rayo de Jalisco Jr.]] |14:48 |- |5 |[[Rayo de Jalisco Jr.]] |[[Universo 2000]] |15:50 |- |6 |[[Silver King (wrestler)|Black Tiger]] |[[Black Warrior (wrestler)|Black Warrior]] |17:48 |- |7 |[[Vampiro]] |[[Mr. Niebla]] |19:23 |- |8 |[[Dr. Wagner Jr.]] |[[Universo 2000]] |21:29 |- |9 |[[El Terrible]] |[[Canek (wrestler)|Canek]] |23:10 |- |10 |[[Brazo de Plata]] |[[Héctor Garza]] |24:03 |- |11 |[[Mr. Niebla]] |[[Pierroth Jr.]] |24:39 |- |12 |[[Black Warrior (wrestler)|Black Warrior]] |[[Héctor Garza]] |26:44 |- |13 |[[Héctor Garza]] |[[Black Warrior (wrestler)|Black Warrior]]
(Double elimination) |26:44 |- |14 |[[Pierroth Jr.]] |[[Canek (wrestler)|Canek]] |28:00 |- |15 |[[Canek (wrestler)|Canek]] |[[Universo 2000]] |29:37 |- |16 |'''Winner''' |Universo 2000 |29:37 |} ==Leyenda de Azul 2005== {{Infobox wrestling event |name=''Leyenda de Azul'' (2005) |image=LuchaLibreObrera064.JPG |caption=[[Último Guerrero]], tournament finalist |promotion = [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] |date=July 15, 2005 |attendance= |venue=[[Arena Mexico]] |city = [[Mexico City, Mexico]] |liveevent=Y |lastevent=[[CMLL Torneo Gran Alternativa#Gran Alternativa 2005|Gran Alternativa]]'' (2005) |nextevent=[[CMLL 72nd Anniversary Show]] |event=''Leyenda de Azul'' |lastevent2=''[[Leyenda de Azul#Leyenda de Azul 2004|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2004) |nextevent2=''[[Leyenda de Azul#Leyenda de Azul 2006|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2006) }} The fourth ''Leyenda de Azul'' took place on July 15, 2005. Unlike previous years' tournaments CMLL did not use the ''torneo cibernetico'' format but instead opted for a 16-man, one night tournament to take place on the July 15, 2005 [[CMLL Super Viernes]] show. The winner of the tournament would also be considered the first CMLL World G1 Heavyweight Champion and win a place in [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]]'s (NJPW) upcoming [[G1 Climax]] tour in August, 2005. While it was never confirmed officially it is believed that NJPW actually decided who they wanted to tour with them and thus who won the tournament. The final match saw [[Lizmark Jr.]] pin [[Último Guerrero]] to earn both the ''Leyenda de Azul'' trophy and the CMLL World G1 Heavyweight Champion. The G1 championship was never referred to again after July 15, 2005, not even when Lizmark Jr. competed in NJPW.{{cite news | author = SuperLuchas staff | title = 2005 Lo Mejor de la Lucha Mexicana | Aniversario de Arena México]]'' |nextevent=''[[Juicio Final (2014)|Juicio Final]]'' (2014) |event=''Leyenda de Azul'' |lastevent2=''[[#Leyenda de Azul 2012|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2012) |nextevent2=''[[#Leyenda de Azul 2016|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (2016) }} After no ''Leyenda de Azul'' tournament in 2013 CMLL promoted the ninth version of the event on June 20, 2014 as the main event of their weekly ''[[CMLL Super Viernes|Super Viernes]]'' ("Super Friday") show. The tournament format saw 16 men complete in a ''[[Torneo cibernetico]]'' elimination match. The finals of the match saw [[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]] eliminate long time rival [[Último Guerrero]] to win the tournament.{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2014/06/21/atlantis-se-llevo-la-leyenda-azul | title= Atlantis se llevó la 'Leyenda Azul' | last=Valdés | first=Apolo | date=June 21, 2014 | accessdate=June 21, 2014 | work=MedioTiempo | language=Spanish}}{{cite web | url=http://deportes.terra.com.mx/otros-deportes/atlantis-se-impone-a-estrellas-del-cmll-en-la-leyenda-azul,138b130b74fb6410VgnVCM5000009ccceb0aRCRD.html | title=Atlantis se impone a estrellas del CMLL en La Leyenda Azul | date=June 21, 2014 | accessdate=July 31, 2014 | publisher=Terra Television |language=Spanish | first=Rosalío | last=Vera}}{{cite web | url=http://www.fuegoenelring.com/noticias_detalle.php?articles_id=3941 | title=ATLANTIS SE CONVIERTE EN LEYENDA AZUL. | work=Fuego en el Ring | publisher=Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre |language=Spanish}}{{cite web | url=https://mx.deportes.yahoo.com/fotos/función-del-viernes-20-de-junio-en-la-arena-méxico-slideshow/;_ylt=AvzI0002F3PHOj6KR_IjwSUdTJd4;_ylu=X3oDMTE2ZGx1dWc1BG1pdAMEcG9zAzMEc2VjA01lZGlhQkNhcm91c2VsTWl4ZWRMUENB;_ylg=X3oDMTBhYnFjc3V2BGxhbmcDZXMtTVg-;_ylv=3 | title=Función del viernes 20 de junio en la Arena México | date=June 20, 2014 | accessdate=July 30, 2014 | first=Gonzalo | last=López | work=Yahoo! |[[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]] | |- |16 |'''Winner''' |[[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]] | |} {{clear}} ==Leyenda de Azul 2016== {{Infobox wrestling event |name=Leyenda de Azul (2016) |image= Championship (2016)]] |nextevent=[[Infierno en el Ring (2016)]] |event=Leyenda de Azul |lastevent2=[[#Leyenda de Azul 2014|Leyenda de Azul]] (2014) |nextevent2=[[#Leyenda de Azul 2017|Leyenda de Azul]] (2017) }} The '''2016 ''Leyenda de Azul''''' (Spanish for "Blue Legend") was a one-night [[professional wrestling tournament]], produced and scripted by the Mexican professional wrestling promotion [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] (CMLL; Spanish for "World Wrestling Council") that was held on November 18, 2016 as part of their weekly ''[[CMLL Super Viernes|Super Viernes]]'' show held at [[Arena México]] in Mexico City, Mexico. The 18-man ''[[torneo cibernetico]]'' elimination match was held in honor of [[Blue Demon]], and was the tenth time CMLL held the ''Leyenda de Azul'' tournament. The teams for the 16-man ''[[torneo cibernetico]]'' match were split by the ''rudo''/''tecnico'' ("bad guys"/"good guys") roles each wrestler portrayed with Team Tecnico consisting of [[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]], [[Blue Panther]], [[Marco Corleone]], [[Diamante Azul]], [[Máximo Sexy]], [[Stuka Jr.]], and [[Valiente (wrestler)|Valiente]], while Team Rudo consisted of [[Euforia (wrestler)|Euforia]], [[Gran Guerrero]], [[Hechicero]], [[El Alebrije (wrestler)|Kráneo]], [[La Máscara (wrestler)|La Máscara]], [[Rey Bucanero]], [[El Terrible]], and [[Último Guerrero]]. The match ended with Último Guerrero pinning Valiente to eliminate him and win the ''Leyenda de Plata'' for the first time.{{cite web | url=http://estrellasdelring.blogspot.com/2016/11/la-leyenda-azul-es-para-el-ultimo.html | title=¡La Leyenda Azul es para el Último Guerrero! | date=November 18, 2016 | accessdate=October 1, 2018 | first=Bibiana | last=Barradas | work=Estrellas del Ring | publisher=[[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]]}} ;Leyenda de Azul 2016 Order of elimination {| class="wikitable sortable" !style="background: ==Leyenda de Azul 2017== {{Infobox wrestling event |name=Leyenda de Azul (2017) |image= |caption= |promotion = [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] |date=December 22, 2017 |attendance= |venue=[[Arena México]] |city = [[Mexico City, Mexico]] |liveevent=Y |lastevent=[[CMLL Día de Muertos (2017)]] |nextevent=[[Sin Salida (2017)]] |event=Leyenda de Azul |lastevent2=[[#Leyenda de Azul 2016|Leyenda de Azul]] (2016) |nextevent2=TBA }} The '''2017 ''Leyenda de Azul''''' (Spanish for "Blue Legend") was a one-night [[professional wrestling tournament]], produced and scripted by the Mexican professional wrestling promotion [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] (CMLL; Spanish for "World Wrestling Council") that was held on December 22, 2017 as part of their weekly ''[[CMLL Super Viernes|Super Viernes]]'' show held at [[Arena México]] in Mexico City, Mexico. The 18-man ''[[torneo cibernetico]]'' elimination match was held in honor of [[Blue Demon]], and was the eleventh time CMLL held the ''Leyenda de Azul'' tournament. The 2017 competitors first faced off in a [[Battle Royal (professional wrestling)|battle royal]] to determine the teams for the main match. Team "A" consisted of [[Euforia (wrestler)|Euforia]], [[Forastero]], [[Máscara Año 2000]], [[Mr. Niebla]], [[El Terrible]], [[Rush (wrestler)|Rush]], [[Vangelis (wrestler)|Vangellys]] and [[Sansón (wrestler)|Sansón]] while Team "B" consisted of [[Último Guerrero]], [[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]], [[El Alebrije (wrestler)|Kráneo]], [[Rey Bucanero]], [[Gran Guerrero]], [[Comandante Pierroth|Pierroth]], [[Hechicero]], and [[Misterioso Jr.]] In the end Rush won the tournament, lastly eliminating Euforia to win the event.{{cite web | url=https://www.solowrestling.com/new/66875-rush-gana-el-torneo-leyenda-de-azul-2017-de-cmll| title=Rush gana el torneo Leyenda de Azul 2017 de CMLL | date=December 24, 2017 | accessdate=September 30, 2018 | language=Spanish | first=Walter | last=Rosales}}{{cite web | url=http://cmll.com/?p=123338 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vvLIFJwy?url=http://cmll.com/?p=123338 | title=Resultados Viernes Arena México: ¡Rush se lleva la Leyenda Azul! | archivedate=December 23, 2017 | date=December 22, 2017 | accessdate=December 23, 2017 | work=Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre | language=Spanish | deadurl=yes | df= }} ;Leyenda de Azul 2017 Order of elimination {| class="wikitable sortable" !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|# !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Eliminated{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2017 | title=Leyenda de Azul 2017 | date=September 22, 2017}} !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Eliminated by !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Time |- |1 |Misterioso Jr. || Sansón || 09:10 |- |2 |Vangellys || Hechicero || 13:11 |- |3 |Máscara Año 2000 || Pierroth || 13:34 |- |4 |Shocker || Euforia || 14:12 |- |5 |Forastero || Rey Bucanero || 15:16 |- |6 |Rey Bucanero || Mr. Niebla ||17:58 |- |7 |Gran Guerrero || Mr. Niebla (double pin) || 21:30 |- |8 |Mr. Niebla || Gran Guerrero (double pin) || 21:30 |- |9 |Hechicero || Rush || 22:20 |- |10 |Sansón || Kraneo || 23:05 |- |11 |Kraneo || El Terrible || 23:32 |- |12 |El Terrible || Último Guerrero || 24:33 |- |13 |Último Guerrero || Rush || 25:44 |- |14 |Pierroth || Euforia || 26:54 |- |15 |Euforia || Rush || 28:40 |- |16 |'''Winner''' || Rush || 28:40 |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre championships}} {{CMLLShows|Leyenda de Azul}} {{Leyenda de Azul}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leyenda De Azul}} {{italic title}} [[Category:Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre tournaments]] [[Category:Recurring events established in 2000]] [[Category:Events in Mexico City]]
